result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic L Collins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  To be kept separate from codefendant Anthony Kirk -14CF441.

miscConds.notes: Fine of $500.00 plus all applicable costs, surcharges, victim witness surcharge and assessments. Any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
Seek/maintain fulltime lawful employment or combination of school and work equaling fulltime.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession, voting.
Provide DNA sample unless previously submitted, pay surcharge.
Mental health evaluation. Comply with any treatment.

No further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No contact with the victims family or codefendant Jerome Anthony Kirk 14CF441.

Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
Pay all supervision fees.
Restitution set at zero.
AODA assessment. Comply with any treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence/condition of probation. Straight time. Forthwith.
Consecutive to any other sentence/condition of probation. Straight time.  **STAYED to be used at the discretion of the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominic L Collins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC, Criminal Complaint, and Court Record sent to Valeria Taylor, Attorney at Law (State Public Defender - 819 N 6th St.).
Order denying request for release privileges received and filed.  Copies mailed to State and defendant./ds
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44 (successor), for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges and release on electronic monitoring.
JusticePoint report received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defense counsel in court.  Defense has a conflict with the sentencing date and request an adjournment.  State does not object.   Case is adjourned to Br 12 for sentencing hearing on 7/23/2014 at 1:30 p.m.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defendant Dominic L Collins in court with attorney Edward L Wright.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Plea negotiations placed on the record. 
  Defendant sworn in. 
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.
Case adjourned to Branch 12.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-17-2014 at 01:30 pm.

05-15-14
Defendant previously posted $1500 (defendant needs to post an additional $500).

Defendant Dominic L Collins in court, in custody.    Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Parties were contacted about this hearing but not able to appear.  Court ordered the matter schedule to the address the defendant's bail due to his violation report.  Cash bail set with TURN OVER TO JusticePoint.  All other conditions remain.  Case remains scheduled for plea hearing on 5/23/2014 at 8:30 a.m.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.
Court ordered the matter scheduled for a bail/bond hearing due to the defendant being remanded.   Case is adjourned to Br 12 for bail/bond hearing on 5/15/2014 at 1:30 p.m.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defendant Dominic L Collins in court with attorney Edward L Wright who appears via telephone.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case worker Jake Kordash.  Case in court due to violation.  Per Judge Borowski, Defendant is to be remanded pending Plea Hearing on May 23, 2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 12.  Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Dominic L Collins in court with attorney Edward L Wright.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for plea hearing.  State has recently provided defense with additional information which defense needs to review with the defendant.  Parties request an adjournment of the plea.    Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-23-2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint report received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defendant Dominic L Collins in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense needs to review the discovery but request a plea date at this time.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Plea hearing scheduled for 04-28-2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Report received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defendant Dominic L Collins in court with attorney Edward Lee Wright.  Megan Carmody for Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO DA/FILE IN COURT.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Arraignment scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/10/14.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jerome Kirk (co-defendant), Andre L. and Lashanda M. as well as their families, residences or workplaces.

Defendant Dominic L Collins in court with attorney Brian B Burke.  Defendant Dominic L Collins in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   
DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
